hints_html: Divide top and bottom by the highest power of x before you proceed.
hints_latex:
Divide top and bottom by the highest power of \emph{x} before you
proceed.
hints_raw: Divide top and bottom by the highest power of ''x'' before you proceed.
question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
If you try to evaluate the limit directly, you end up with \(\infty\)/\(\infty\), which means we cannot conclude anything for the moment, more work needs to be done. Here we have

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2x}{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}} &= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\frac{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}}{x}} \\ &= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\frac{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}}{\sqrt{x^2}}} \\ &= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\sqrt{\frac{9x^2 + x -1}{x^2}}} \\ &= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\sqrt{9 + \frac{1}{x} - \frac{1}{x^2}}} \\ &= \frac{2}{\sqrt{9}} \\ &= \frac{2}{3} .\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
If you try to evaluate the limit directly, you end up with
$\infty$/$\infty$, which means we cannot conclude anything for the
moment, more work needs to be done. Here we have

\begin{align*}
\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2x}{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}} &= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\frac{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}}{x}}  \\
&= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\frac{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}}{\sqrt{x^2}}}  \\
&= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\sqrt{\frac{9x^2 + x -1}{x^2}}}  \\
&= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\sqrt{9 + \frac{1}{x} - \frac{1}{x^2}}}  \\
&= \frac{2}{\sqrt{9}} \\
&= \frac{2}{3} .
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
If you try to evaluate the limit directly, you end up with ∞/∞, which means we cannot conclude anything for the moment, more work needs to be done. Here we have
:<math> 
\begin{align}
\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2x}{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}} &= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\frac{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}}{x}}  \\
&= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\frac{\sqrt{9x^2 + x -1}}{\sqrt{x^2}}}  \\
&= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\sqrt{\frac{9x^2 + x -1}{x^2}}}  \\
&= \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2}{\sqrt{9 + \frac{1}{x} - \frac{1}{x^2}}}  \\
&= \frac{2}{\sqrt{9}} \\
&= \frac{2}{3} .
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:

Evaluate

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x-1}}\end{aligned}\]

or determine that the limit does not exist.
